feed.title: The Media Cell Of SGGSIE&T, Nanded

entry.title: Utsav 2k23
entry.summary: UTSAV is a three-day cultural event organized by SGGSIET, Nanded. It is…
entry.content:
UTSAV is a three-day cultural event organized by SGGSIET, Nanded. It is a platform for the students of the institute to showcase their talents and participate in various cultural activities. The event is managed by Team UTSAV, who are responsible for the successful execution of the entire program. This team comprises of dedicated students who work tirelessly to ensure that all the arrangements are made in a smooth and efficient manner.

During the UTSAV, students participate in a wide range of cultural activities such as singing, dancing, drama, and poetry recitation, to name a few. The event is also graced by the presence of renowned celebrities, who add to the excitement and glamour of the occasion. The celebrities interact with the students and encourage them to pursue their passions and interests.

Team UTSAV also plays an important role in conducting various cultural activities in the campus throughout the year. They are responsible for organizing workshops, competitions, and other events that help to foster a sense of community and creativity among the students.

In conclusion, UTSAV is an important event in the calendar of SGGSIET, Nanded, and serves as a platform for students to showcase their talents and interact with each other. The hard work and dedication of Team UTSAV helps to ensure that the event is a resounding success and that the students leave with cherished memories.

entry.title: Pragyaa 2k23
entry.summary: Pragyaa is the annual technical festival organized by Shri Guru Gobind Singhji…
entry.content:
Pragyaa is the annual technical festival organized by Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology in Nanded, India. It is a national level event that attracts students from various engineering colleges and universities from all over the country.

The festival usually consists of a variety of events and competitions in fields such as robotics, programming, technical quiz, coding, and other technical as well as cultural events like music, dance, drama, fashion shows, and photography. It provides a platform for students to showcase their technical and cultural talents, and also provides an opportunity for students to network and learn from each other.

Pragyaa is a highly anticipated event in the academic calendar and is known for its well-organized events, exciting prizes, and its reputation as a hub for young tech enthusiasts and creative minds. It is an ideal platform for students to gain practical knowledge and experience, interact with experts and professionals in the industry, and develop important skills such as teamwork, leadership, and problem-solving.

Overall, Pragyaa is a celebration of technology, creativity, and talent, and it is a perfect opportunity for students to enrich their college experience and have fun at the same time.

entry.title: Zenith 2k23
entry.summary: After the grand success of Zenith'20 , Zenith'21 & Zenith'22 We are…
entry.content:
After the grand success of Zenith'20 , Zenith'21 & Zenith'22 We are back with Zenith'23 - the 7th edition of our fiesta. This year the tagline is "Devour the Victory!!!". Last year this Sports extravaganza was scheduled in the month of February 2023 and was organised online .

There were many games that included Workout Wonders, NBA Live , Carrom Disc Pool, Free Style Football, Sports Quiz at intercollegiate levels and table tennis, chess, football, rink football, volleyball, kabaddi, cricket, basketball, handball, yoga,tug of war, ahtletics at intra-collegiate levels.

With the sport activities we conducted some social activites like orphanage activities, "run for health" (dream marathon). Prizes worth over 4.5 lakhs were awarded in the previous edition of ZENITH. The intercollegiate fiesta Zenith'20 , Zenith'21 & Zenith'22 competed among various Engineering colleges across the state.

The 8th edition of Zenith, the annual state level sports extravaganza organized by Shri Guru Gobind Singhji Institute of Engineering and Technology in Nanded, India, is coming soon with the tagline "Devour the Victory". This year's festival promises to be even more exciting and action-packed than previous years, with a wide range of indoor and outdoor sports events for students from colleges and universities across the state to participate in and showcase their athletic abilities.

Zenith is known for its well-organized events, exciting prizes, and its reputation as a hub for young athletes and sports enthusiasts. The festival provides a great platform for students to stay active, have fun, and develop important life skills such as teamwork, leadership, and communication.

This year's event is expected to draw a large number of participants, making it one of the largest and most anticipated sports festivals in the state. The festival will provide an opportunity for students to showcase their skills, challenge each other, and participate in a fun and competitive atmosphere.

The 8th edition of Zenith is shaping up to be an unforgettable experience, and the organizers are working hard to make sure that this year's festival will be even more memorable than previous years. Whether participating or spectating, Zenith promises to be a thrilling and exciting event that will be enjoyed by all involved. So come and join the fun, and let's Devour the Victory together!

entry.content:
Clubs & Events at SGGSIE&T‚ú®

entry.title: 74th Republic Day
entry.summary: Today, We Celebrated our 74th Republic Day at SGGSIE&T, Nanded. 73 years…
entry.content:
Today, We Celebrated our 74th Republic Day at SGGSIE&T, Nanded. 73 years ago, we formally became a Republic and adopted our constitution on this very day. Republic Day fills each and every one of us with strong emotions. It brings to mind powerful images of India's military, parading to the world with its full might and grandeur. It inspires us with the moving accounts of the bravery and gallantry award winners.

On this glorious day, Team Drishti created a huge rangoli filled with vibrant colors that grabbed everyone's attention and became the highlight of the occasion.¬†

The event began with Flag Hosting by Our Hon. Director Sir and Chief guest of the day Shri Baba Sukhwinder Singh Ji, followed by salutes and marches by the guards. "Avaroh" the music club of the institute also graced the occasion with their mellifluent patriotic chores.¬†

The College chose this day to felicitate the sport achievement of the students in various tournaments. The college men's Football team, basketball team, chess champion boys; women's handball team, volleyball team, chess champion girls, and the most special our college cricket team that won the inter-college cricket tournament were felicitated.

A blood Donation camp was organized by NSS that received a remarkable response from college students. This was really a great initiative towards mankind and the nation to fill the droning blood banks.

A Street play was performed by "Gandharwa" the drama club of the institute.

The play "Kya Fark Padhta Hai" really took us into deep thought about the corruption, irrelevant politics, and cyber crimes prevailing in the country. It also questioned us about what role we play in stopping these crimes and supporting the nation.

Our institute has over 3000 students and so many faculties that come from different cultural, linguistic, social, religious, political, and ideological areas. Yes!! we are different but we are of the same kind!!

¬†

An effort by us to remark this day....üáÆüá≥

entry.title: GuruPurab 2k23
entry.summary: Gurupurab of Gurugobind Singh Ji Maharaj- On 20th Jan our institute celebrated…
entry.content:
Gurupurab of Gurugobind Singh Ji Maharaj-

On 20th Jan our institute celebrated the Gurupurab of Shri Guru Gobind Singh ji Maharaj. Guru Gobind Singh ji was the 10th Sikh Guru. He was a spiritual master and a warrior. he made various significant contributions to Sikhism and was solely responsible for the establishment of Khalsa pants. he initiated the five K's tradition that held a lot of importance. Apart from establishing the khalsa, Guru Gobind Singh declared that guru Granth sahib is the permanent Sikh guru, and his teachings are respected and followed worldwide.

The ceremony was endowed with the presence of gurudwara Sants - Sant Baba Ram Singh Ji, Baba Sukhwinder Singh ji, and Jattedar Baba Teja Singh Ji. The Ceremony began with Pushp Arpan and lamp enlightenment at Guru Gobind Singh ji's memorial. The guests of honor of the ceremony were welcomed by our Director sir with Shawl and bouquet.

The ceremony was further preceded by a student speech on the life of Shri Guru Gobind Singh ji and his sacrifices. The student mentioned that Guru Gobind Singh ji was born in Bihar Patna and was known as Govind rai in his early years. Our director sir also paid respect to this occasion by thanking the chief guests and remembering Guru Gobind Singh ji's teachings to steer the students.

The guests of honor Shri Baba ram Singh ji and Shri baba Sukhwinder Singh ji also embarked on the ceremony with their words of wisdom. They encouraged the students to maintain the dignity of the college and always be proud to be a part of this institute.

The guests of honor also thanked the director and staff members of our institute for the smooth functioning of the institute by offering their blessings in the form of shawls.

The ceremony was concluded with a vote of thanks by Pokhare Sir and Kokare Sir Dean Academics of the institute.

Prasad was distributed to all the attendees after the ceremony and in honor of the Jayanti, a langar was organized on the textile lawn of the campus for students and staff members. Everyone enjoyed the delicious food and with this, the ceremony concluded.

¬†

entry.title: Face Painting 2k23
entry.summary: Team Drishti organized one of the most amazing events of our institute,…
entry.content:
Team Drishti organized one of the most amazing events of our institute, which was Face Paintingü§©. Every face was not only filled with colors but with characters that had a story to tell!!

Some were roaming with their horror faces and some with cutely painted faces but I think everyone's favorite was the one who carried 'The boys' tag and who doesn't love music, not just that but enjoying the music along with painting, artists know that that's why they created a vibe that people will not only love but will remember. üíù
Not everyone participated but was too interested to get their faces painted, so some drew tattoos on their faces. ü§≠

Winners are not those who do things best than anyone else but who do things uniquely!!

Winners for the event were Manthan Khose, Chaitanya Panchal, and Bhagyashree Narwadkar, how amazing they created that messed face painting.. followed by Pranoti Dhone, Swati Wankhade, Gunjan Dadhiwale who were the 1st runner ups and the 2nd runner ups were the freshers Rajlaxmi Watgule, Vipakshi Mate, Ashutosh Hamand.¬†

It was a great experience and everyone had so much fun! Something that's carved into everyones momeory stone.‚ú®

entry.title: Road Safety
entry.summary: On 17/01/23 we had a road safety program arranged in our college,…
entry.content:
On 17/01/23 we had a road safety program arranged in our college, the program initially focused on how we need to take safety measures to avoid major and severe accidents. The chief guests of this program were Mr. Avinash Kumar Sir(post-upper superintendent of police, Nanded); the honorable Mr.Shailesh Kamat Sir.

The program started with instructions on rules and regulations and some important information about basic symbols that one must know before using the road as a means of transport, like ‚ÄúWe should always walk on the right side of the road‚Äù, ‚ÄúIf in case the indicators of our respective vehicle are not working properly then we should use specific hand gestures‚Äù. Also information like the use of helmets and seat belts to avoid major injuries in case of accidents, the proper way to use road signs/traffic signs to prevent rush and grave major accidents, types of road signs like mandatory signs, informative signs, etc. Detailed information about highway hypnosis which is still a foreign concept to many was also explained. Later on, a beautiful felicitation ceremony took place. Then the students were guided by Mrs. Rupali Kamble Mam. She briefed us about how one can use these rules and safety precautionary measures. She informed us about the number of accidents happening every year and the number is definitely a huge one. A major amount of accidents are happening due to alcoholism. She also explained the purpose of symbols instead of words is for guidance on road for illiterate people. The information shared by her was very valuable.

By wishing us a safe and bright future she ended her speech. A campaign ‚ÄúWalk on Right‚Äù which states beautifully how one must walk on the right side of the road for their safety that recently took place in Nanded was also shown. Mr. Shailesh Kamat Sir shared some more information about safety measures that one must follow while being on road. A few wise words shared by him were, ‚ÄúIn road safety, there are mainly four E‚Äôs which are important; Education, Enforcement, Engineering, and Emergency Care.‚Äù He explained and told us how these four E‚Äôs are important for every individual who uses the road as a means of transport. He also said, ‚ÄúIf we follow safety rules then we can safe ourselves from serious and major accidents‚Äù, he gave an example of how one famous businessman Mr. Cyrus Mistry lost his life in a car accident for not wearing a seat belt. All the students were further guided by Mr. Avinash Kumar about road safety. While sharing his opinions about road safety he also told us about his engineering days and a few memories related to it.¬†

Last but not least our respected director sir shared his experience and knowledge while also stating mandatory rules like one must wear a helmet if riding a two-wheeler on college premises.¬†

The entire ceremony was concluded in a grand manner by singing National Anthem.

All these delegates removed some of their precious time and guided us. Their efforts for the safety of citizens were really felt as the information shared by them was brief yet covered all the important points related to road safety. Last but not least-

‚ÄúThe future of the road safety movement is not much dependent upon the invention of safety devices as on the improvement of methods of¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†educating people to the ideal of caution and safety.‚Äù

¬†

entry.title: 42nd Foundation Day
entry.summary: 17th of December 2022, Saturday, the NSS unit has arranged our Institute…
entry.content:
17th of December 2022, Saturday, the NSS unit has arranged our Institute Foundation Day. It was the day to remember, cherish, and recognize the students. The illustrious 41 years have seen SGGS contributing to society by giving ethical engineers and research insights. The institute celebrated it with aplomb in the august presence of Sant Baba Sukhwinder Singh Ji, (Gurudwara Langar Sahib Nanded), Dr. P D Jadhav (Former I/C Principal), Prof. B M Naik (Former Principal), Prof. C B Deshpande(Former Principal), Dr. L M Waghmare (Former Director) & Dr. Y V Joshi (Director SGGSIE&T).

The theme for the 42nd year of our Institute is ‚Äò|| ‡§§‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§§‡§§‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§Æ‡§Ø ||‚Äô presented by the NSS unit. The function started at 11:00 AM with a warm welcome of all honorable guests. Light symbolizes brightness and prosperity. It removes the forces of darkness and gives us positivity. In spiritual words, light means life. So, we can also think of light as giving us a new direction in life. With this noble thought, the function started with lightning of lamps & worshiping ‚ÄòShri Guru Gobind Singh Ji‚Äô by our guests.

Our Institute‚Äôs FSDC Club has performed Ganeshwandana & the cultural performance presented by Avaroh-The Musical Club. The program preface & the presentation on the history of our institute were represented by Dr. Mlind Bhalerao, Head of the ExTC Department.

After this felicitation of guest done by Dr. Y V Joshi, Director SGGSIE&T.¬†

The valuable guidance for students was given by Sant Baba Sukhwinder Singh Ji. Dr. P D Jadhav brought back the memories of institute history in his speech. Prof C B Deshpande & Prof B M Naik shared their experiences along with students. Dr. L M Waghmare shared his experience in the institute and gave the advice to utilize and earn the knowledge of technical facilities that are present. Dr. Y V Joshi has expressed his thoughts on the 42nd Institute Foundation Day of our institute. He appreciated the organizers and all the student volunteer committees for organizing this event.

Thereafter the felicitation of retired professor, teaching & non-teaching staff has been done by our guests along with our director sir. After all the guest lectures & felicitation of a retired professor, teaching & non-teaching staff speech was over, Dr. P G Jadhav expressed a vote of thanks.

It was the day to remember, cherish, recognize for the students. The function has¬†
concluded by singing our National Anthem.

Glimpses of 42nd Institute Foundation Day ‚ú® -

¬†

entry.title: Alumni Meet 2k22
entry.summary: Life has many phases and the best part of it is college…
entry.content:
Life has many phases and the best part of it is college life . after many years coming back ‚Ä¶.. It is the time when we have flashbacks with good memories and bad though. In our prestigious college , Alumni meet 2022 was organized on 23rd and 24th of December 2022 by our faculty coordinator Dr M.V.Vaidya and the NSS club of our college.¬†

In this we had great fun and time to interact with them . All together there were three batches of the year : 1996, 1997 and 1998. The respected alumni had a great time enjoying these two days . The best part of the event was that they truly inspired us with their words.

¬†The event started at 09:00. They had breakfast at 09:00 am arranged in the food court . The media committee of team Chitraksha had amazing interaction with the Alumni . We had a questionnaire with them , and they shared their memorable and beautiful experience. The moments and their memories were so wonderful. Talking about their experience, it was that for nearly after 25 years they visited the college and they used to have great fun banter with each other during that time.¬†

They said that the college has major changes. And they shared how the college helped them to build and how they are successful in their life till now. They had a very good conversation with us. Their memories had so many emotions filled with love , immense joy and fun. And they said those three four years were the best part of their life and having fun with friends was one of the major and the best part. In their time they used to have a ‚Äò Dev mama canteen ‚Äò in the college and one tree hill point ¬†that was the place where they used to hangout and chill with friends. The alumni shared their college memories, mentioning the changes in the college campus, facilities, and atmosphere. They were really impressed to see the infrastructure and greenery of the campus. Speaking about earlier facilities they told us that the labs and libraries were available 24x7 that helped them to learn and explore. This is one of the reasons that pushed them up in their life. When asked about the college events they mentioned the Khojagiri Poornima used to be celebrated above the rooftops of their departments overnight. They also mentioned about the earthquake that took place.¬†

At 10:00 am to 12:30 pm they had respective departments' interaction with faculty and students. It was a great meeting with them. And from 12:30 pm to 2 pm they had lunch organized in the food court. And from 2 pm to 5:30 pm we had a felicitation program of 1996 , 1997 and 1998 batch alumni in the main function hall . The event's chief guest was Mr. Abhijeet Raut, Hon. District collector. The event continued by our hon. director felicitating our alumni with a memorable frame. The alumni also introduced themselves and their work. They all were successful personalities, who expressed their desire to participate in and partner with various initiatives of the institute. An Alumni association of our college was launched "SEAA" i.e. SGGS Engineering Alumni Association.

They shared so much about their life after and before SGGS . We had a cultural program from 7 pm onwards. It was so much and they enjoyed it a lot . They danced and many of them were singing songs . It was great to listen to them and see them enjoying . Still in their 40s they had such great energy and enthusiasm. They had lunch and after that they had a bonfire and they enjoyed very well. On the next day 24 December from 09:00 am to 12:00 pm they had a sports bonanza along with breakfast on the sports ground. They had many events and literally they enjoyed each and every part of the event. And at last from 2:30 pm they had a visit to Kaleshwar temple and Gurudwara.

Overall it was a great event and we all had so much fun!!

¬†
